comments.commentBody:
As the daughter of high school dropouts and the granddaughter of immigrants, I felt fortunate to be accepted by the local state university. My SAT scores were abysmally low. However, my own sons received near perfect scores on the SAT and went on to graduate from Harvard and Stanford. How could a mother be so much "dumber" than her own children?

Seriously, the relatively low SAT scores of teachers are related to the fact that many k-12 teachers come from the working class. Critics of teachers are constantly reminding everyone that they (teachers) are "less intelligent" than other college grads (based on the SAT) but the truth is that prospective teachers perform very well in college and in life. Their relatively low SAT scores indicate their modest backgrounds, and not their intelligence or ability to do well. I hope the New York Times writes an article on this subject because citizens need to know. A person's SAT score is closely related to his socioeconomic background. This is the case with all standardized tests.

Martin, I agree with your comments completely—except that I will never believe Gore "lost" to Bush.  Rather, Bush was appointed by the Supreme Court, and the country has paid dearly for it ever since.  Let's hope enough people have the sense to realize that Obama could not possibly "fix" the mess Bush spent eight years making, and that Romney or Santorum will only repeat the Bush mistakes—and add to them.

Obama is going to have to do some more explaining on gas prices to hold his edge. Is there nothing he can do directly to curb the role of speculation in oil markets? If Robert Reich is accurate, it's gambling on price that is actually driving price.
What about the unsustainable debt?

This narrative that Romney is in trouble because he can't win over the base is ludicrous.  Alabama is not going blue.  Romney should be worrying about the middle, that is where this election will be won.  The conservative establishment knows this; it's why they've been banking on Romney - the only moderate in the race - from the start.

San Francisco is considering ending free parking for those in possession of disabled placards. While city officials are motivated by the loss in revenue, it would cut down a lot of the abuse which other drivers find annoying. But it's a state law and it has to be changed by the state legislature, the city cannot make changes unilaterally.

If I go up to San Francisco on a week day, which I do once or twice a year, I know the area close to where I want to be is metered. So I don't even bother. It's surrounded by several blocks of parking for residents only, a phenomenon known as the privatization of public space. Beyond that it's open and that's where I look for a place until I find one. But I get angry as I walk past the metered spots and lose count of the number of cars displaying disabled placards.
The problem is, despite all this, all of the major GOP candidates are very close to Obama in the polls.
I agree! Imagine if we put all of the energy and money now spent on war into education. This is how America should lead.

There was no good reason for the Army to go to Afghanistan other than they couldn't stand it that the Air Force was doing all the work? The didn't have Iraq yet and the Air Force had made Operation Desert Storm a walk in the park?

I agree, I once had the opportunity to restart the planet' s 65 million year clock. I was only a few feet away from the button. I could have solved every problem that humanity had, and would ever have. I missed my one and only opportunity to save mankind form itself.

We put our combat soldiers in an untenable position when we send them into a country and ask them to respect the people, but kill some of them mainly for political views (however deplorable we may find those views) that are against American interests. You cannot respect a group of people and then dehumanize only some of them-- it is not humanly possible. Those who do respect the people become traumatized by what they are expected to do, those who dehumanize become like animals that engage in torture, humiliation and degradation, desecration of holy books, and murders. Although there are many soldiers that fall between, the extreme circumstances of war create far more "outliers" than more normal circumstances would.

Humanity is ready and must move beyond war now. We are too aware, too conscious of the immorality of it. We can simply no longer justify it. And we should no longer tolerate it.

Why am I not surprised. And I'll bet these guys will deny they have a problem with alcohol and those around them will say the same. Listen up people, if you do this kind of stuff while drinking, you are not a 'normal' drinker. And that's especially true of those who claim otherwise.
True.  That's the other side of this sad, sad affair.

I'm glad his wife has a job. I doubt she would get much in the way of benefits or pay if and when he is dishonorably discharged, and many military wives give up their entire lives for their husband's careers. Dooming her and their children to be paupers due to his crime would be to compound tragedy.
Yes, and let's not forget that Obama won the Nobel Peace Prize.  And you can just see why.
They are trying to get back into office to carry out the screwy policies that got us in this mess.

Where is Obama?
He sent additional troops to Afghanistan.
Remember?

He also ordered the extra-judicial execution of a US citizen, in Yemen.

Forget the old regime, they are not getting reelected.
Worry about the guy who is in chagre right now and who has not pulled the troops out after three plus years
Where are Bushy &Chenny now?  As well as the rest of the War Monger Republicans???

We cannot comprehend this soldier's crimes, but my opinion is that we cannot comprehend what his experience has been these past ten years.  War calls on people to perform heinous acts...and at what cost?  Soldiers suffer physically, emotionally, and spiritually.  I grieve for this soldier's victims, but I also grieve for the soldier and his family.  May there be mercy enough for all of them.
Draft NOW! we'll see how many are willing to support the death or exaction of unknown soldiers to your family.
would you consider suicide a killer rampage?

@ Marc:

No. Suicide can be due to depression and other individual psychological problems or due to war induced stress. Each case has to be judged individually. After all, there are soldiers who commit suicide while in the U.S. or at non-combat posts.

In order to draw conclusions, one needs to get the exact number of soldiers who have completed three tours of duty in Iraq and then determine the percentage of those who commit suicide or go on killer rampages to get an accurate picture.

If the allegations are true (which seems possible considering two other soldiers are facing disciplinary action for drinking with him that night according to the story), we may have a soldier who got drunk, went out to commit mayhem and then upon returning to his base hours later after having sobered up had the presence of mind to invoke his rights to a lawyer. Hardly the signs of a mental breakdown.

Before immediately assuming PTSD or any connection to his previous three tours of duty elsewhere, why not give equal credence to the possibility of his being someone with deep seated anger issues which surface when he's had too much to drink? Especially if the part about previous tensions with his wife is correct. Just another mean drunk who after hitting the sauce, had the opportunity and means to destroy defenseless people whom he probably hated. Without knowing all the facts to come out at trial, just as likely a possibility as war induced stress.

After all, at least hundreds if not thousands of other US soldiers have honorably served three previous tours of duty in Iraq without going on killing rampages.

Here's what you should do, Mike: Wait for the details of what actually happened to be released before rushing to judgement. I hear what you're saying about jurisdiction, but the military doesn't generally turn over one of their own to a state with a lower standard of justice than they would get in America--part of that guarantee given us by the Bill of Rights. The Afghans would almost certainly kill the suspect in retribution. Retribution is not justice. Retribution is retribution. And in most states of America, we're better than that.

Oh, and: Go Red Sox!
OK, but U.S. taxpayers should not pay for his legal defense.

This is what they should do: The soldier did this outside the scope of his duties; on his own time; of his own volition; on sovereign Afghan territory. He should be subject to Afghan laws.

The US military should court martial him to sever his connection with our military and hand him over to Afghan authorities. The best that the US should do is get him some competent counsel to protect his rights under Afghan law and keep an eye on things to ensure that the soldier gets due process, as it exists, in the jurisdiction where he committed the alleged crime.

There are some people still confusing that the president has control on gas price, especially low educate and gop voters. The fact is no president in history has control gas price, because it's a global commodity, which it can be fluctuated base on Wall Street speculation. If president Obama can control gas price, he would set it at 0.99 cents per gallon, so he can stimulate this economy further just like he has being fighting for payroll tax cut for working for American, for middle class tax cut, for unemployment extension, etc, and wrap up the election now, instead of still fighting. Is that made sense? Take a look at this video below how Fox News distorted gas price, and blame on the president.

http://mediamatters.org/blog/201203050007

Typical left bias. The republican party has a problem. Huge. Really. I would say the democrat party has a problem Huge. As I recall Obama had a difficult tme beating Hilary in the primaries.And, there are a number of democrat people that wished she would have won.  We have an incumbent president that is below 50% in polls, really just a little over 42% in approvel. This time Obama  will not be the easy sell by the liberal media like in 2008. Lol. He has a track record and his track record is not very appealing to most of the electorate. His solution to our nations problems is to spend his way out of them and create massive deficits to load on future generations. Democrat senate that has failed to pass a budget in over three years. Refused to sign off on the Keystone pipeline and lost jobs for alot of union members, high gas prices, bailed out Wall Street, first president toireside over a downgrade in our credit rating, Huge unemployment, the real number is around 18% when you count the number of people that have quit looking and the number working part time jobs, 1% growth in our economy, more people on food stamps than ever.  What does he have to run on. When Mitt wins the presidential primary we will rally behind him. Time for a change folks.
Putting the wars in the actual budget that the Republicans put in Emergency funding helped bust the bank. Wake up!

The danger to our democracy is centralized executive power. Our founding fathers fled tyranny. That is why they set up a system of checks and balances. The executive, the legislative, and the judicial. Obama has made a grave mistake of centralizing power within his branch. Bypassing congress time and again, appointing 45 czars that do not have to answer to anyone but him Be careful what you wish for is what I have always heard. When the republoicans win they will have the desire to do the same thing. Centralize power within the executive branch, bypass congress, rule by executive fiat.  It is not good for either party to do. It opens the door for the next party that wins to do the same thing and I don't think people that are democrats are going to like it one bit. The founding fathers knew what they were doing when they set up our democracy. But, human nature likes power and we have seen that in Washington with both the republicans and democrats.

I would say it's a pretty careless poll. So don't pay any attention to it. They completely left out Latinos, muslims and many others that make up a huge proportion of our population. Perhaps the poll reflects those locked out of the voting process that the GOP has worked so hard to enforce. Or it's a poll from the 1940s. Thanks for pointing it out.

Some of the simplistic comments posted here are amazing! During the 1980s, the US supported the Taliban. Bin Laden turned on the US after the first Iraq war in what was an obvious case of blowback. Decades of war have left Afghanistan a disaster. That country is no better off than it was in 2001! Repeated deployments of an all-volunteer military have created the kind of havoc that took place when this unidentified soldier lost his mind and perpetrated atrocities. There is also a report that this soldier may have suffered a head injury in an earlier deployment. Where did the command authority break down in allowing another deployment of this soldier to a war zone following an injury that may have affected his behavior? Military training teaches soldiers to devalue the lives and culture of the enemy. It's a type of systematic dehumanization that has taken place in all wars in recent history. How else can people be expected to act against the most basic admonition not to kill?
Count me as one who is happy not to be living in your "sane" world.

While Obama and his crew were partying with the Hungarian convincted felon (in France) and financial markets manipulator George Soros, the most frequent visitor to the WH in the first month of the Obama Presidency according to the official WH logs - not to mention the underwriter of too many hard-left outfits to mention (including Media Matters?)

The Right has said from the moment Obama was elected that their man focus was to make sure that Obama was a one term President. The Right pursued this objective to the detriment of the nation, the economy and the american people. It was always all about the Power.
FOr the RIght wing to say that Obama did not unite them is absurd. Obama often offered Republican Ideas in his proposals only to have the Right reject, filibuster, and vote against their own ideas....Need an example?

How about the so called Obamacare-all Republican ideas! Gingrich helped the Heritage Foundation come up with this model in response to Hillary Care!

How about Cap and Trade? A republican idea! And it worked!
You don't hear about Acid rain or the Ozone problem anymore do you? Why? Cap and Trade. It worked!

The only reason the Republicans defied these ideas is because Obama liked them.

For the Repugs to go against and work against the President and then say he does not unite them is almost as lame as the Republicans saying that government is the problem and then when they take control of it they prove that government doesn't work. I believe it is called a self fullfilling prophecy.

Any questions?
I predict that Mitt Romney will choose a Latino man or woman to be his VP.
